intro: Cheirinia cuspidata, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Cheirinia cuspidata is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
